column5: test

Things I didn't like and observations while using:
1. When setting up, you need to login for the first time from within the hub after you save it. Recommendation would be to save the login screens of key apps (JIRA, Figma, etc.) into hubs and then access
2. I was thinking about notifications from applications and sites within the browser. However, I think it would make sense to configure notifications for those individually and not have browser notifications for now
3. Slack browser-based version was a bit slow to load compared to the application, but that's okay
4. Be prepared for a lot of 2-factor authentication if you're first setting up your Oasis work environment
5. While tagging Sites and adding them to hubs, I mainly added tags that were related to the name of the article or thing. For example, I did a "Grok" tag for "Grok"
6. I noticed that some sites like Grok and Notion do not load and may only be available on specific browsers
7. I found myself relying on the ai buddy a lot rather than remember where each site was saved
feedback
abcd

column5: Whenever I transcribe something with voice to text, it adds a period to the end of the text. I've noticed that if you leave the period there, it often causes the AI Assistant to incorrectly perform the desired command (e.g., it'll open a new window instead of organizing). So I always have to manually delete the period before I hit enter - if this period is just not included in the transcription, performance will improve

column5:
Right now, it is not possible to change the title of a link you saved to a hub such that the change appears in the "Select View Layout" panel. Whatever the title of that link is within the browser window/tab at the the time you save it is permanently what stays in the menu (even though you can add a meta-title, that doesn't show up in the "Select View Layout" panel. This can be very confusing and sometimes makes it difficult or even impossible to remember what the link is (see screenshot with titles like "Google Sheets: Sign-in" and "Page Not Found".

This should be updated such that you can change the title of the link that appears within the Select View Layout menu.
